name: Ethan Carter
message: Great question! For project structure, I recommend organizing your backend and frontend into separate directories. Use npm or yarn to manage dependencies. For authentication, use JWT. For state management, try Context or Redux.
postTitle: Best Practices for Full Stack JavaScript Projects

name: Olivia Harper
message: I'd recommend using Express generator for backend and Vite for frontend. Use dotenv for environment configs too.
postTitle: Best Practices for Full Stack JavaScript Projects

name: Michael Chen
message: Don't forget about testing! Jest for unit tests and Cypress for E2E testing can save you lots of debugging time later.

name: Sophia Rodriguez
message: Consider using TypeScript if your project is large-scale. The type safety is worth the initial setup time.
